Performances

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Performances are locked specializations used by characters with the bard skill to produce various effects on their targets. In many way performances are much like maneuvers.

Targeting Performances

A bard has a limited number of potential targeting options. Generally, all of these options are available, though some specific Performances limit these choices further. All rules are written as if the bard was targeting a single individual (a serenade), even if it cannot be used as a Serenade. Targeting more individuals divides their ranks by the square root of the number of targets.

  • Serenade- The bard chooses a single target and plays for that individual's sole benefit.
  • Campfire- The bard plays for the sole benefit of those in his group.
  • Gstanzl- The bard plays for the benefit of everyone present, but excludes those who are in his group from his targeting.
  • Concert- Any individual who can perceive (see/hear) the performance is targeted by it.


Performances

Performances provide mechanical game-effects. However, they must be appropriate to the social and non-magical nature of this skill, avoiding the typical grab-bag of bardic effects, and not making other skills (most notably healer and magic) superfluous.

Lullaby

Treat as healing check (replacing healer with bard), but restores stamina at only half the rate; .05 rather than .1 * endurance.

Berceuse

Treat as healing check (replacing healer with bard), but restores willpower equal to .1 * the subject's resolve, rather than restoring stamina.

Exultation

Actually, a collection of different performances. Each of which provides a bonus to the target in a skill determined by the performance. Each check by the performer provides "virtual XP" to that skill equal to the success % until the next check.

Jam

Technically, this is simply the Bard Exultation. Similarly, a set of characters who form a group during which all (or most) use this Performance are called a band.

Anthem

Similar to Exultations, this is actually a group of performances- each of which benefit an individual ability. Each check by the performer provides "virtual XP" to that ability equal to one tenth the success % until the next check.

Others

(this header is a dumping ground for stuff that hasn't been addressed yet)

Mindgames

mild mental status effects (fascination, confusion, charm)

Inversions

There is little reason that most of the above bonuses couldn't simply be inverted. To prevent making the bard skill a "superskill" the inversions should be weakened and be separate performances

dirge

Every 10 seconds check bard * sapience, penalized by the target's Resolve * Endurance. If this check is successful, reduce the target's stamina by .025 * (stamina target used during the previous 10 seconds) per point of success. If the target is resting, or otherwise has used less than half a point of stamina during the previous 10 seconds, treat as though they used .5 stamina.

requiem

Every 10 seconds check bard * sapience, penalized by the target's Resolve * Endurance. If this check is successful, reduce the target's willpower by .05 * (willpower target used during the previous 10 seconds) per point of success. If the target is resting, or otherwise has used less than half a point of willpower during the previous 10 seconds, treat as though they used .5 willpower.

threnody

Actually, a collection of different performances. Each of which provides a penalty to the target in a skill determined by the performance. Each check by the performer provides negative "virtual XP" to that skill equal to the success % until the next check. Such checks are penalized by the target's Resolve * subject skill.
